source:
# **Link sample:
https://docs.delta.io/latest/quick-start.html#language-SQL

https://microsoftlearning.github.io/mslearn-synapse/Instructions/Labs/05-Use-delta-lake.html

Be aware of this sample is using SQL, you can also use Python, Scale as well

#Set the path of delta location
delta_table_root = "abfss://zone-connected@datalakegen2atlasdev.dfs.core.windows.net/"
delta_table_path = delta_table_root + "sap_crm/delta/CRMBPART"
print(delta_table_path)

#initial load from parquet
#df = spark.read.load('abfss://zone-connected@datalakegen2atlasdev.dfs.core.windows.net/released/sapcrm/notebooks/partitioned_data/CCRMBPART/Year=*/Month=*', format='parquet')

# Write dataframe to delta table 
#df.write.format("delta").save(delta_table_path)

#Get latest date from delta table

from pyspark.sql.functions import max

# Rename field in dataframe
df = df.withColumnRenamed('0CREATEDON', 'CREATEDON')

# Get latest date / collect()[0][0] #first  column, first row
LastDate = df.select(max(df.CREATEDON)).na.fill("20140101").collect()[0][0]

print(LastDate)

from delta.tables import *
from pyspark.sql.functions import *

# Create a deltaTable object
deltaTable = DeltaTable.forPath(spark, delta_table_path)

# Delete every row later than lastdate
#deltaTable.delete(condition = expr(f"0CREATEDON >= {LastDate}" ))

# Get new data with variable latest date
newData = spark.read.load('abfss://zone-connected@datalakegen2atlasdev.dfs.core.windows.net/released/sapcrm/notebooks/partitioned_data/CCRMBPART/Year=*/Month=*', format='parquet').filter(f"0CREATEDON >= {LastDate}")

# Using Merge to update/insert new data
deltaTable.alias("oldData") \
  .merge(
    newData.alias("newData"),
    "oldData.ZBPARTNER = newData.ZBPARTNER") \
  .whenMatchedUpdate(
                      set = 
                                { 
                                  "ZBPARTNER": col("newData.ZBPARTNER"), 
                                  "ZBPARTNER___T": col("newData.ZBPARTNER___T"),
                                  "0BP_GUID": col("newData.0BP_GUID"),
                                  "FP_SOURCE": col("newData.FP_SOURCE"),                            
                                  "0BP_ID_TYPE": col("newData.0BP_ID_TYPE"),
                                  "FP_SOURCE___T": col("newData.FP_SOURCE___T"),
                                  "0BP_TYPE": col("newData.0BP_TYPE"),
                                  "0BP_TYPE___T": col("newData.0BP_TYPE___T"),                         
                                  "0BP_CAT___T": col("newData.0BP_CAT___T"),
                                  "0BP_GROUP": col("newData.0BP_GROUP"),
                                  "0BP_GROUP___T": col("newData.0BP_GROUP___T"),
                                  "0INFOPROV": col("newData.0INFOPROV"),
                                  "ZZMOB_NUM": col("newData.ZZMOB_NUM"),
                                  "ZZMOB_COU": col("newData.ZZMOB_COU"),                       
                                  "ZZPHO_NUM": col("newData.ZZPHO_NUM"),
                                  "ZZPHO_COU": col("newData.ZZPHO_COU"),
                                  "ZZEMAIL": col("newData.ZZEMAIL"),                                                   
                                  "0CREATEDON": col("newData.0CREATEDON"),
                                  "1ROWCOUNT": col("newData.1ROWCOUNT")
                              }
                      ) \
  .whenNotMatchedInsert(
                        values = 
                                {
                                  "ZBPARTNER": col("newData.ZBPARTNER"), 
                                  "ZBPARTNER___T": col("newData.ZBPARTNER___T"),
                                  "0BP_GUID": col("newData.0BP_GUID"),
                                  "FP_SOURCE": col("newData.FP_SOURCE"),                            
                                  "0BP_ID_TYPE": col("newData.0BP_ID_TYPE"),
                                  "FP_SOURCE___T": col("newData.FP_SOURCE___T"),
                                  "0BP_TYPE": col("newData.0BP_TYPE"),
                                  "0BP_TYPE___T": col("newData.0BP_TYPE___T"),                         
                                  "0BP_CAT___T": col("newData.0BP_CAT___T"),
                                  "0BP_GROUP": col("newData.0BP_GROUP"),
                                  "0BP_GROUP___T": col("newData.0BP_GROUP___T"),
                                  "0INFOPROV": col("newData.0INFOPROV"),
                                  "ZZMOB_NUM": col("newData.ZZMOB_NUM"),
                                  "ZZMOB_COU": col("newData.ZZMOB_COU"),                       
                                  "ZZPHO_NUM": col("newData.ZZPHO_NUM"),
                                  "ZZPHO_COU": col("newData.ZZPHO_COU"),
                                  "ZZEMAIL": col("newData.ZZEMAIL"),                                                   
                                  "0CREATEDON": col("newData.0CREATEDON"),
                                  "1ROWCOUNT": col("newData.1ROWCOUNT")  
                                  }
                          ) \
  .execute()


display(deltaTable.toDF())

#df = spark.read.format("delta").load(deltaTable)
#display(df.limit(10))

#Time Travel
from delta.tables import *
from pyspark.sql.functions import *

# Time travel
deltaTable = DeltaTable.forPath(spark, delta_table_path)

# Modify the code you just ran as follows, specifying the option to use the time travel feature of delta lake to view a previous version of the data.
#version_df = spark.read.format("delta").option("versionAsOf", 0).load(delta_table_path)
#display(version_df.limit(10))

timestamp_df = spark.read.format("delta").option("timestampAsOf", '2023-04-19 09:22:18').load(delta_table_path)
display(timestamp_df.limit(10))

# The history of the last 20 changes to the table is shown - there should be two (the original creation, and the update you made.)
#deltaTable.history(20).show(20, False, True)

%%sql
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW c
    (ID COMMENT 'Unique identification number', Name) 
    COMMENT 'View for experienced employees'
    AS SELECT * FROM delta.delta_table_path;
        WHERE working_years > 5;
Â

# Create catalog tables - Create managed table
df.write.format("delta").saveAsTable("atlas-srvless-sql-dev.CRMBPARTManaged")
spark.sql("DESCRIBE EXTENDED atlas-srvless-sql-dev.CRMBPARTManaged").show(truncate=False)
